cnd13:1.2: For those who do not dwell in their desires,

cnd13:2.1: "Those who do not dwell in their desires": Anyone who cannot abide by his
cnd13:2.2: desires, does not dwell, does not live, does not stay.
cnd13:3.1: "[Like this Venerable Todeyya]": "Like this," the continuation of sentences; the
cnd13:3.2: connection of sentences; the completion of sentences; the combination of words;
cnd13:3.3: the connection of words; this is the order of sentences, which is "like this."
cnd13:3.4: "Venerable," this is a synonym of love, respect, respect, and obedience. This is
cnd13:3.5: "Venerable." "Todeyya," the name, title, security, common name, appellation.
cnd13:4.1: "For him, thirst is not discovered": For him, thirst is no more, does not exist,
cnd13:4.2: is not known, is not found, has been cut off, ceased, calmed down, stopped,
cnd13:4.3: cannot arise, was burned by the fire of wisdom.
cnd13:5.1: "Those who have passed all doubts": Those who have passed, surpassed, crossed,
cnd13:6.1: "What is his relief like?": "What is his liberation like, what type of
cnd13:6.2: establishment, and what type of contrast should be desired?" He asked about
cnd13:7.2: For those who do not dwell in their desires,

cnd13:8.1: "Anyone whose desires have been overcome by him": people, Arahants, and those
cnd13:8.2: who have exhausted their troubles. "Desire," there are two types of desires: the
cnd13:8.3: desire for things and the desire for pollution. What are the desires for things?
cnd13:8.4: Desirable sight, sound, smell, taste, touch; bedding, clothing, maidservants,
cnd13:8.5: goats and sheep, chickens and pigs, elephants, cows, horses, mules, horses,
cnd13:8.6: fields, houses, gold, gold coins, villages and towns, capitals, countries,
cnd13:8.7: territories, treasuries, warehouses; everything that can be tainted by greed is
cnd13:9.1: In addition, there are past desires, future desires, present desires, internal
cnd13:9.2: desires, external desires, internal and external desires, inferior desires,
cnd13:9.3: medium desires, superior desires; desires in the suffering world, human desires,
cnd13:9.4: heavenly desires, existing desire, created desire, uncreated desire, created
cnd13:9.5: desire by others, possessed desire, unpossessed desire, cherished desire,
cnd13:9.6: non-cherished desires; the desires of all the worlds of desire, the desires of
cnd13:9.7: all the worlds of physicality, all the desires of the world of non-material
cnd13:9.8: worlds, dependence on thirst and desire for love, desiring righteousness, greed
cnd13:9.9: for righteousness, the desire to be intoxicated by righteousness and happiness,
cnd13:9.10: is called the desire for things.
cnd13:10.1: What is the desire for defilement? The desire for desire, the desire for greed,
cnd13:10.2: the desire of desire to greed, the desire of intention, the desire for lust, the
cnd13:10.3: desire for intention, the joy of desire, love obsession, the binding harness of
cnd13:10.4: desire, attachment, the desire for cover.
cnd13:11.2: Wanting to be produced by thought (intention),
cnd13:11.3: I will not think of them,
cnd13:12.1: These are called polluting desires. Craving thirst, attachment, it is greed,
cnd13:12.2: lust... (omitted) unwholesome roots. "Should not dwell in desire": In the desire
cnd13:12.3: to pollute, one should not be greedy, or obstructed in the desire of things,
cnd13:12.4: should be separated from greed, and those who have excluded greed, have been
cnd13:12.5: freed from greed, have renounced greed, have no greed, have eliminated greed,
cnd13:12.6: those who have attained the cessation of greed, have no hunger and thirst, those
cnd13:12.7: who have extinguished, have become cool, and feel joy, should live as a
cnd13:13.1: "[The Blessed One: 'Todeyya!']": "Todeyya," the Blessed One calls the Brāhmaṇa
cnd13:13.2: by his surname. "The Blessed One" is synonymous with respect. In addition, the
cnd13:13.3: "greed breaker" is the Blessed One; the "sickness destroyer" is the Blessed One;
cnd13:13.4: "the one who has destroyed conceit" is the Blessed One; "the one who has
cnd13:13.5: destroyed the thorns" is the Blessed One; "the one who has destroyed the
cnd13:13.6: pollutants" is Blessed One; "the one who has ended" is the Blessed One; "the one
cnd13:13.7: who has practiced the body, the precepts, the mind, and the wisdom" is the
cnd13:13.8: Blessed One; or "the Blessed One is close to the woods, wild forests, and border
cnd13:13.9: dwellings (sitting place), where speaking is lessened, it is quiet, away from
cnd13:13.10: the human atmosphere, alone, and suitable for sitting alone" is the Blessed One;
cnd13:13.11: or "the Blessed One is the one who divides clothes, food, shelter, the needs of
cnd13:13.12: patients, and medical necessities"; or "the Blessed One is the one who has the
cnd13:13.13: taste of righteousness, the taste of Dhamma, the taste of liberation, the
cnd13:13.14: increased precepts, the mind, and the wisdom"; or "the Blessed One is the four
cnd13:13.15: types of jhāna, the four immeasurables, the four formlessness, etc., the one who
cnd13:13.16: divides is the Blessed One"; or the Blessed One is the one who has the eighth
cnd13:13.17: liberation, the eight victories, the ninth dwelling place, etc.; or the Blessed
cnd13:13.18: One is the practice of ten thoughts, (ten) abidings, the one who (observes) the
cnd13:13.19: in and out of breath; the one who is purely divided is the Blessed One; or the
cnd13:13.20: Blessed One divides the four mindfulness, the four righteousness, the four
cnd13:13.21: divine bases (iddhipāda), the five faculties, the five powers, the seven
cnd13:13.22: enlightenment factors, and the eight branches of the holy path; or the Blessed
cnd13:13.23: One is ten Tathāgata, four fearlessness, four unobstructed solutions, six
cnd13:13.24: supernatural powers and the six enlightenment methods. "Blessed One," this name
cnd13:13.25: is not given by the mother; not given by the father; not given by brothers; not
cnd13:13.26: given by sisters; not given by friends; not given by relatives; not given by
cnd13:13.27: Samaṇas or Brāhmaṇas; not given by heaven; it is ultimate liberation; the
cnd13:13.28: establishment (of the pseudonym) for the acquisition and testimony of the
cnd13:13.29: Buddha, the Blessed One, under the Bodhi tree, and all knowledge and wisdom,
cnd13:14.1: "For him, thirst is not found": "thirst," for form, sound, smell, taste, touch,
cnd13:14.2: Dhamma. "For him," for the Arahant, for the one who has exhausted his troubles.
cnd13:14.3: "For him, thirst is not discovered": For him, thirst does not exist, is not
cnd13:14.4: known, is not found, has been cut off, ceased, calmed down, stopped, cannot
cnd13:14.5: arise, has been burned by the fire of wisdom.
cnd13:15.1: "And whoever has passed the doubts": Doubts are called suspicions: Doubts are
cnd13:15.2: called doubts: doubt of suffering, doubt of the path leading to suffering, doubt
cnd13:15.3: of the future, doubt of the past, doubt of the future and the past, doubt of
cnd13:15.4: causal connections, such doubts, suspicions, doubtful states, confusion,
cnd13:15.5: hesitation, crossroads, inconsistent grasping, hesitating, incomplete
cnd13:15.6: understanding, stiff state, confusion of mind. "Who..." means anyone who is an
cnd13:15.7: Arahant and has exhausted his troubles. "The doubts have been passed": passed,
cnd13:16.1: "There is no further relief for him": There is no further liberation for him.
cnd13:16.2: Anyone who should be liberated is liberated, and for him what should be

cnd13:18.1: "The one who is away from desire or the one who desires": Is he a person who has
cnd13:18.2: no desire or a person who thirsts? The forms, does he desire, the sounds..., the
cnd13:18.3: smells, the tastes, the touches, the dhammas, a home, group (congregation),
cnd13:18.4: dwelling, profit, fame, praise, happiness, clothing, food... (omitted), past,
cnd13:18.5: future, present, what is seen, heard, felt, and known, the dhamma, does he want,
cnd13:19.1: "Is he a wise person or of wise manner": "Is he a wise person," is he a wise
cnd13:19.2: person, an enlightened person, and a distinguished person. Or using the
cnd13:19.3: eight-level wisdom, or using the five gods to provide wisdom, or using the evil
cnd13:19.4: wisdom, the construction of eagerness, or the construction of seeing. He builds,
cnd13:20.1: "Sakyamuni! According to which, I can know a Muni": "Sakyamuni," "Sakyamuni,"
cnd13:20.2: Sakyamuni is a bhikkhu from the house of Sakya. This is Sakyamuni. Or, "the
cnd13:20.3: rich, the wealthy," this is also Sakyamuni. For him there are these wealth,
cnd13:20.4: namely: trusting wealth, abstaining from wealth, ashamed of wealth, hearing
cnd13:20.5: about wealth, giving wealth, wisdom wealth, mindfulness of wealth, righteous
cnd13:20.6: wealth, divine wealth, root wealth, strength wealth, enlightenment wealth, Path
cnd13:20.7: wealth, Fruit wealth, Nibbāna wealth, and use these various treasures as the
cnd13:20.8: rich, the wealthy. Or, those who are possible, those who are able, those who
cnd13:20.9: flow out all types of things, those who are sufficient, those who are heroes,
cnd13:20.10: those who are brave, those who are heroic, those who are not timid, those who
cnd13:20.11: are not frightened, those who do not run away, those who have given up fear of
cnd13:20.12: fear, those who have given up terror and fear. Doubts are called doubts: ....
cnd13:20.13: "Sakyamuni! So that I can know a Muni according to this": Sakyamuni! According
cnd13:20.14: to which I can know, know for sure, and penetrate "Muni".
cnd13:21.1: "All-eyes, please explain that to me": "That," whatever I ask; whatever I beg;
cnd13:21.2: whatever I inquire about, whatever makes me clear. "Please explain," please
cnd13:21.3: explain, please teach, please inform, please establish, please uncover, please
cnd13:21.4: analyze, please clarify. "All eyes," all eyes are called the state of
cnd13:21.5: all-knowing wisdom. Therefore, the Blessed One reaches (has), enters, enters
cnd13:21.6: completely, has sufficiently, the state of wisdom.
cnd13:22.1: "For him, there is nothing unseen here (in this world),
cnd13:22.2: There is no knowledge that cannot be known,
cnd13:22.3: He proves that everything that exists should be guided by inference,
cnd13:22.4: Because the Tathāgata, like that, is all-eyes."

cnd13:23.3: He is the one who has the wisdom,

cnd13:24.1: "He is the one who is away from the desire, not the one who desires": He is not
cnd13:24.2: the one who desires, he does not desire for all the forms, all the sounds...,
cnd13:24.3: ...all things knowable. He doesn't hope, accept, desire, or pray.
cnd13:25.1: "He is a wise man, not of a wise manner": "He is a wise man," he is a wise man,
cnd13:25.2: an enlightened man, a wise man, and a distinguished man. "Not of a wise manner,"
cnd13:25.3: with eight levels of wisdom, or with the five gods for wisdom, or with evil
cnd13:25.4: wisdom, the thirsty construction he does not build, or sees the construction he
cnd13:25.5: does not build, produce, or arise, does not make it to be born.
cnd13:26.1: "Todeyya! This is how you know Muni": "Muni," Muni is called wisdom,
cnd13:26.2: understanding, simple selection, investigation, discernment, recognition,
cnd13:26.3: discrimination, close observation, inspection, learned virtuous wisdom,
cnd13:26.4: proficiency, cleverness, study, reflection, review, contemplation, examination,
cnd13:26.5: general comprehensive wisdom, vipassanā, right knowledge, stabbing rod, wisdom
cnd13:26.6: root, wisdom sword, wisdom palace, wisdom brightness, wisdom light, no delusion,
cnd13:26.7: choice of dhamma, right view. The Blessed One has the wisdom of Muni, reaching
cnd13:26.8: Muni. There are three Muni (perfect virtues): body Muni, language Muni,
cnd13:27.1: What is the body of Muni? The three types of body and evil deeds are cut off as
cnd13:27.2: the Muni position; the three types of good behaviors are the Muni position; the
cnd13:27.3: wisdom in the body is the Muni position; the knowledge of the body is the Muni
cnd13:27.4: position; walking the Path with (higher) knowledge is the body of Muni; the
cnd13:27.5: abandonment of desire and greed, cut off, as the Muni; the fourth jhāna
cnd13:27.6: extinction of the body is the position of Muni.
cnd13:28.1: What is the language of Muni? The abandonment of the four types of evil deeds of
cnd13:28.2: language is the position of Muni; the four types of good acts of language are
cnd13:28.3: the position of Muni; the wisdom of linguistic objects is the position of Muni;
cnd13:28.4: the knowledge of language is the position of Muni; and knowing the path of all
cnd13:28.5: acts is the position of Muni; the abandonment of desire and greed of language is
cnd13:28.6: the position of Muni; the second jhāna cessation of language is the position of
cnd13:29.1: What is intention Muni? The three types of deeds of intention and evil deeds are
cnd13:29.2: the Muni position; the three types of good deeds are the Muni position; the
cnd13:29.3: wisdom in the mind-object is the Muni position; the knowledge of the heart is
cnd13:29.4: the Muni position; the one that walks the Path with knowledge is the position of
cnd13:29.5: Muni; the desire and greed of the heart being judged is the position of Muni;
cnd13:29.6: the desire to perish the mind is the position of Muni.
cnd13:30.1: "Body Muni, Language Muni, and Intention Muni are no troubles,
cnd13:30.2: Muni has the status of Muni, and they say he is the one who cuts everything.
cnd13:30.3: Body Muni, Language Muni, and Intention Muni are no troubles,
cnd13:30.4: Muni has the status of Muni, and they say that they are those who have been cleansed of evil."
cnd13:31.1: The six types of Muni have these three modes of Muni: Muni at home, Muni without
cnd13:31.2: a home, Muni with learning, Muni without learning, Bhikkhu Muni, Muni (of the)
cnd13:31.3: Muni. Which is at home? Those laymen who have seen the footsteps and have
cnd13:31.4: learned the precepts, these are at home. Which are homeless Muni? Those bhikkhus
cnd13:31.5: who have seen the footsteps and who have learned the precepts are homeless Muni.
cnd13:31.6: There are seven types of learning for learning Muni, Arahant for non-learning
cnd13:31.7: Muni, and Bhikkhu Buddha as Bhikkhu Muni. Muni (of) Muni is called Tathāgata,
cnd13:32.1: "Non-wise is Muni, a foolish and ignorant man,
cnd13:32.2: After raising the scale, take the top one and become a wise man.
cnd13:32.3: Avoid all evils, that Muni became Muni because of that,
cnd13:32.4: Everyone who understands the (inner and outer sum) in the world,
cnd13:32.5: Because that is said to be Muni.
cnd13:32.6: Who knows all the inside and outside of the world,
cnd13:32.7: The unwholesome and the good behind the Dhamma,
cnd13:32.8: Everyone who is supported (respected) by heaven and man,
cnd13:32.9: Beyond staining and the net, he is Muni."
cnd13:33.1: "Todeyya! Know Muni in this way": Todeyya! Know, agree, understand, and pass
cnd13:34.1: "No owning, no obsession with desire and existence": "No owning," no greed, no
cnd13:34.2: hatred, no ignorance, no sloth, no sight, no pollution, no possession of evil
cnd13:34.3: deeds. For him who has been cut off, ceased, calmed down, stopped, cannot arise,
cnd13:34.4: and burned by the fire of wisdom, he is called non-owning. "Desire," there are
cnd13:34.5: two types of desires: the desire for things and the desire for pollution. What
cnd13:34.6: are the desires for things? Desirable form, desirable sound, desirable smell,
cnd13:34.7: desirable taste, desirable touch, bedding, clothing, maidservants, goats and
cnd13:34.8: sheep, chickens and pigs, elephants, cows, horses, mules, fields, houses, gold,
cnd13:34.9: gold coins, villages and towns, capitals, countries, territories, treasuries,
cnd13:34.10: warehouses; everything that can be tainted by greed is the desire of things.
cnd13:35.1: In addition, there are past desires, future desires, present desires, internal
cnd13:35.2: desires, external desires, internal and external desires, inferior desires,
cnd13:35.3: medium desires, superior desires, desires in the suffering world, human desires,
cnd13:35.4: desire of heaven, the desire that has been present, the desire that has been
cnd13:35.5: created, the desire that has not been created, the desire that has been created
cnd13:35.6: by others, the desire that has been possessed, the desire that is not possessed,
cnd13:35.7: the desire to be cherished, the desire not to be cherished, all the desires of
cnd13:35.8: the world of desires, all the desires of the physical world, all the desires of
cnd13:35.9: the non-material world, relying on thirst, taking craving as the subject, so
cnd13:35.10: that people want righteousness; so that they will be infected by craving (for)
cnd13:35.11: righteousness; to be intoxicated by righteousness as desires, these are called
cnd13:36.1: What is the desire for pollution? The desire of desire, the desire of greed, the
cnd13:36.2: desire of desire to greed, the desire of intention, the desire of the intention
cnd13:36.3: of greed, that is the desire of desire, the greed of desire, the joy of desire,
cnd13:36.4: desire love, desire enthusiasm, desire fascination, desire seizure, desire
cnd13:36.5: torrent, desire harness (binding), desire attachment, desire cover.
cnd13:37.2: Wanting to be produced by thought (intention),
cnd13:37.3: I will not think of them,
cnd13:38.1: These are called the desire for pollution. "Existence," there are two types:
cnd13:38.2: kamma and rebirth. What is kamma? Blessed deeds, non-blessed deeds, and
cnd13:38.3: immovable deeds are kamma. What is rebirth? The forms, feelings, thoughts,
cnd13:38.4: behaviors and consciousness of this person are reborn.
cnd13:39.1: "No owning, and there is no obsession in desire or existence": A person who has
cnd13:39.2: no possessions is unattached, unhindranced, unobstructed, detached, already
cnd13:39.3: freed, liberated, freed from bondage, he dwells with an unrestrained heart.
cnd13:40.1: At the end of these verses... "The Blessed One is my teacher, I am a disciple."
